intro: Galatella collina, commonly known as the mountain galatella, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Galatella collina is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat.
